items.sentence: They're two different words meaning the same thing.
Do you think it's OK to tell Tom about what we did?
It looked like Tom was about to jump into the pool.
Tom says he isn't planning to stay here all winter.
Tom said he isn't sure whether Mary has to do that.
Tom is hard to get along with, but he isn't stupid.
Maybe Tom doesn't know he isn't likely to be fired.
You're going to need to learn to fend for yourself.
The boy's name is Tom, and the girl's name is Mary.
That wasn't as easy to do as I thought it would be.
Did Tom say he thought it would be easy to do that?
I need to go to the drugstore and buy a few things.
Tom started working in Australia several years ago.
Tom started taking French classes after he retired.
Tom opened the shower door and reached for a towel.
Tom kept on talking as though nothing had happened.
I make it a rule never to be late for appointments.
I like to serve unusual foods at my dinner parties.
I sometimes hear my father singing in the bathroom.
I think it's about time we got down to brass tacks.
